content.description: Good vertical climb on sandstone with plenty of varnish. Small hands, and fairly sustained 5.8 to 5.9 grade throughout. 5.10a crux is above the last bolt before the chains.
content.location: Follow the description for getting to the Breakfast Nook. The first route you will come to. 20' to the left of Bat's Meow.

content.description: The climbing started right off the ground and was consistent almost the whole way up.  The last 20-30 feet or so eased up and there was a good stance at the anchors.  Fun cracks to put gear in, but it didn't strike me as a good beginner trad climb.  Better as a climb for a 5.7 trad leader to stretch themselves on.
content.protection: There were enough cracks and features to only use small to medium cams on this climb, though a climber could find placements for large cams as well.  Chain anchors at the top to rappel from.
content.location: After following the trail between two rock faces (on the back side of Island in the Sky), you will come to a clearing.  On the wall on the left you will see some bolts going up.  About 20 feet to the right of this is a series of vertical cracks and features going up.   This is the Bat's Meow.
